snippet: Thiel Fellowships pay young people to forgo college and to plunge into real-world projects. So what has become of those who managed to snag fellowships?
abstract: Thiel Fellowships, started by Silicon Valley investor Peter A Thiel, pay young people $50,000 a year for two years to forgo college and to plunge into the real world of science, technology and business; 44 fellows have been chosen over the last two years; some projects include a smartphone game app and a rotating solar panel.
lead_paragraph: Thiel Fellowships pay young people to forgo college and to plunge into real-world projects. So what has become of those who managed to snag fellowships?

headline.seo: The Thiel Fellows, Forgoing College to Pursue Dreams
headline.print_headline: Drop Out, Dive In, Start Up
